db:abstract.db:para: Attracts particles towards a position or a shape.
This type was introduced in Qt 6.2.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: This element attracts particles towards a position inside the 3D view. To model the gravity of a massive object whose center of gravity is far away, use Gravity3D.
The attraction position is defined either with the position and positionVariation or with shape. If both are defined, shape is used.

db:section.db:title: duration : int
db:section.db:para: This property defines the duration in milliseconds how long it takes for particles to reach the attaction position. When the value is -1, particle lifeSpan is used as the duration.

db:section.db:title: durationVariation : int
db:section.db:para: This property defines the duration variation in milliseconds. The actual duration to reach attractor is between duration - durationVariation and duration + durationVariation.

db:section.db:title: hideAtEnd : bool
db:section.db:para: This property defines if the particle should disappear when it reaches the attractor.

db:section.db:title: positionVariation : vector3d
db:section.db:para: This property defines the variation on attract position. It can be used to not attract into a single point, but randomly towards a wider area. Here is an example how to attract particles into some random point inside (50, 50, 50) cube at position (100, 0, 0) within 2 to 4 seconds:

db:section.db:title: positionsAmount : int
db:section.db:para: This property defines the amount of possible positions stored within the attractor shape. By default the amount equals the particle count, but a lower amount can be used for a smaller cache. Higher amount can be used for additional randomization.

db:section.db:title: shape : ParticleAbstractShape3D
db:section.db:para: This property defines a ParticleAbstractShape3D for particles attraction. Each particle will be attracted into a random position inside this shape. This is an alternative for defining position and positionVariation. Here is an example how to attract particles into some random point inside sphere by the end of the particles lifeSpan:

db:section.db:title: useCachedPositions : bool
db:section.db:para: This property defines if the attractor caches possible positions within its shape. Cached positions give less random results but are better for performance.
